alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Comanche; Dewey (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 8:14PM CDT until June 02 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest, southwest, and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Oklahoma, Blaine and Dewey. In southwest Oklahoma, Caddo, Comanche and Kiowa. In western Oklahoma, Custer and Washita. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Cordell, Carnegie, Thomas, Hydro, Arapaho, Mountain View, Canton, Corn, Custer City, Eakly, Longdale, Gotebo, Bessie, Colony, Oakwood, Cooperton and Cloud Chief. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
